titleStmt.title: Rede me and be nott wrothe for I saye no thynge but trothe I will ascende makynge my state so hye, that my pompous honoure shall never dye. O caytyfe when thou thynkest least of all, with confusion thou shalt have a fall.
titleStmt.author: Barlow, William, fl. 1527.
Barlowe, Jerome, fl. 1527 attributed name.
Roy, William, fl. 1527-1531, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Variously attributed to William Barlow, to Jerome Barlowe, and to William Roy.
A satire in verse directed against Cardinal Thomas Wolsey.
Title page in red and black.
Identified as STC 21427 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
